class Evolution_Controls.Best_Predicted_EC.Best_Predicted_EC(surr)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Informed_EC.Informed_EC

Class for best predicted EC.

Candidates with lower predicted cost (i.e. objective value predicted by the surrogate) are more promising.

Pareto-based (from Tian-2018)¶

class Evolution_Controls.Pareto_Tian2018_EC.Pareto_Tian2018_EC(surr)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Informed_EC.Informed_EC

Class for bi-objective Pareto-based EC from Tian-2018.

Candidates with lower non-dominated rank according to predicted cost minimization and prediction variance minimization are more promising.

Adaptive (from Wang-2020)¶

class Evolution_Controls.Adaptive_Wang2020_EC.Adaptive_Wang2020_EC(surr, search_budget, uncert_treatment)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Informed_EC.Informed_EC

Class for Wang-2020’s adaptive EC.

At the beginning of the search minimization of the predicted cost prevails (favoring fast convergence). As the search progresses, more importance is given to uncertainty minimization (favoring exploitation) or uncertainty maximization (favoring exploration).

Parameters

  • search_budget (positive int, not zero) – search budget (expressed either in number of generations, number of cycles, number of batches or time)

  • weight (float) – weight (alpha in Wang-2020)

  • uncert_treatment (int) – 1 for uncertainty minimization, -1 for uncertainty maximization

__init__ method’s input

Parameters

  • surr (Surrogate) – surrogate model

  • uncert_treatment (str) – “min” for uncertainty minimization, “max” for uncertainty maximization

get_sorted_indexes(pop)¶

Returns the candidates’ indexes sorted in descending promise order.

Parameters

pop (Population) – population to split

Returns

list of indexes

Return type

np.ndarray

get_IC_value(dvec)¶

Returns the promise values of candidates.

Parameters

dvec (np.ndarray) – decision vectors

Returns

the promise

Return type

np.ndarray

update_EC(search_progress)¶

Set the weight according to the search progress.

Parameters

search_progress (positive int) – current search progress (expressed either in number of generations, number of cycles, number of batches or time)

Pareto¶

class Evolution_Controls.Pareto_EC.Pareto_EC(coeffs, distinct_mode, *ECs)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Ensemble_EC.Ensemble_EC

Class for Pareto-based EC.

Candidates with lower non-dominated rank according to minimization of the ECs (multiplied by their respective coefficient 1 or -1) are more promising.

Parameters

  • coeffs (np.ndarray) – coefficients (1 or -1) to multiply the EC with (allow to convert a minimization problem into a maximization problem and reversely)

  • distinct_mode – criterion to distinguish solutions with same non domination rank. When equals to ‘rand’ solutions considered as more promising are choosen randomly. When equals ‘cd’ solutions with higher crowded distance are considered as more promising. When equals to ‘hvc’, solutions with higher hypervolume contribution are considered as more promising.

__init__ method’s input

Parameters

ECs (list(Evolution_Control)) – evolution controls

get_sorted_indexes(pop)¶

Returns the candidates’ indexes sorted in descending promise order.

Parameters

pop (Population) – population to split

Returns

list of indexes

Return type

np.ndarray

get_IC_value(dvec)¶

Returns the promise values of candidates.

Parameters

dvec (np.ndarray) – decision vectors

Returns

the promise

Return type

np.ndarray

Dynamic¶

class Evolution_Controls.Dynamic_EC.Dynamic_EC(search_budget, sections, *ECs)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Ensemble_EC.Ensemble_EC

Class for dynamic EC.

Only one EC is active at a time. The active EC changes during the search according to the search budget, the activation sections and the current search progress.

Parameters

  • search_budget (positive int, not zero) – search budget (expressed either in number of generations, number of acquisition processes or time)

  • sections (list) – activation sections (determines the moment to change the active EC)

  • idx_active (positive int) – index of the current active EC in ECs_list

__init__ method’s input

Parameters

ECs (list(Evolution_Control)) – evolution controls

get_sorted_indexes(pop)¶

Returns the candidates’ indexes sorted in descending promise order.

Parameters

pop (Population) – population to split

Returns

list of indexes

Return type

np.ndarray

Returns the promise values of candidates.

Parameters

dvec (np.ndarray) – decision vectors

Returns

the promise

Return type

np.ndarray

update_active(search_progress)¶

Update the active EC.

Parameters

search_progress (positive int) – current search progress (expressed either in number of generations, number of acquisition processes or time)

Adaptive¶

class Evolution_Controls.Adaptive_EC.Adaptive_EC(n_sim, n_pred, n_disc, rew_func, sim_costs, pred_costs, *ECs)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Ensemble_EC.Ensemble_EC

Class for adaptive EC.

Only one EC is active at a time. The active EC changes during the search according to a reward mechanism based on a reward function, a threshold and the error between the simulated costs and the predicted costs computed on the last batch of candidates.

Parameters

  • n_sim (positive int, not zero) – number of simulated candidates from the batch

  • n_pred (positive int, not zero) – number of predicted candidates from the batch

  • n_disc (positive int) – number of discarded candidates from the batch

  • ECs_reward (list) – rewards of each EC

  • idx_active (positive int) – index of the current active EC in ECs_list

  • threshold (float) – threshold value (mean error between simulated costs and predicted costs from the last batches of simulations)

  • rew_func (function) – reward function (among sign, linear, tanh, asympt)

  • saved_idx (np.ndarray) – 1 row per EC. A row contains the candidates indexes (into the population) ordered according to the associated EC.

  • to_be_updated (bool) – True if the adaptive EC has to be updated, False otherwise

__init__ method’s input

Parameters

  • rew_func (str) – reward function (among sign, linear, tanh, asympt)

  • sim_costs (np.ndarray) – simulation costs of the last batch of candidates (to initialize threshold)

  • pred_costs (np.ndarray) – prediction costs of the last batch of candidates (to initialize threshold)

  • ECs (list(Evolution_Control)) – evolution controls

get_sorted_indexes(pop)¶

Returns the candidates’ indexes sorted in descending promise order.

Parameters

pop (Population) – population to split

Returns

list of indexes

Return type

np.ndarray

get_IC_value(dvec)¶

Returns the promise values of candidates.

Parameters

dvec (np.ndarray) – decision vectors

Returns

the promise

Return type

np.ndarray

update_active(sim_costs, pred_costs)¶

Update the active EC and the threshold.

The error, computed as the difference between simulated and predicted costs over the last batch of candidates, is compared to the threshold. A small error produces a reward for ECs that should have decided to simulate (including the active EC) and produces a penalty for other ECs. A large error produces a penalty for ECs that should have decided to simulate (including the active EC) and produces a reward for other ECs.

Parameters

  • sim_costs (np.ndarray) – simulation costs of the last batch of candidates (to compute the error)

  • pred_costs (np.ndarray) – prediction costs of the last batch of candidates (to compute the error)

class Evolution_Controls.Committee_EC.Committee_EC(n_sim, *ECs)¶

Bases: Evolution_Controls.Ensemble_EC.Ensemble_EC

Class for committee of evolution controls.

All the ECs vote to determine the promise of the candidates.
